page.title: 03Housing in West End, Stoke
page.content: In West End, Stoke, the houses are mainly terraced.This is because they take up less space and are cheap to build.Some houses in Foden Street have been knocked down.There is no new housing except for some small bungalows suitable for old people. In Shelburne Street, the terraced houses have got a line of tiles in the brick work.Each tile has 'Gold Coin' on it.A man put a bet on a horse called Gold Coin.The horse won and with the money he built a row of terraced houses. My house is a terraced house.It has three bedrooms,two living rooms,a bath room and a big kitchen.It has a garden with some fruit trees.It also has a garage.
